div.h1: Recent Updates and Announcements from FHEVS

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.span: The 2020 Ohio Primary Election originally scheduled for March 17, 2020,
p.strong: will now be conducted by absentee ballot through April 28
p.span: . To receive an absentee ballot, voters must submit an Absentee Ballot Application through their county Board of Elections. The website for the Lake County Board of Elections can be found here:

span.a: Click here to read an informative letter from the Board of Education

a.title: Go to comments for Support Fairport Harbor Schools

p.span: Dear Skipper Families,
Please CLICK HEREto read the information letter from the Board of Education and HERE to read the letter from the Village of Fairport Harbor.

COVID-19 is a serious health matter that we are monitoring closely, and we will continue to share information as it becomes available. Please know that as always, the health and safety of our students and staff is our highest priority and will remain vigilant in our efforts to help prevent the spread of illness.
References:
Ohio Health Department:
Centers for Disease Control & Prevention:
World Health Organization:
Lake County General Health District:

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Update

span.p: For the most current information please go tocdc.gov

p.a: Ohio Department of Education COVID-19 FAQ

a.title: Go to comments for Communicable Diseases Letter

p.strong: Please note all kindergarten screenings will be postponed to a later date. Mrs. Doreen Fischer will contact those that have signed up with more information as it becomes available. Thank you for your patience as we weather COVID-19 mandated closures.

a.title: Go to comments for Kindergarten Screening 20-21 School Year

span.p: Congratulations to our very own Nathan Yaussy for being awarded $25,000 and title of Ohio Milken Educator Award Winner for 2019!

p.a: See photos and the write up here Milken Educator Awards

a.title: Go to comments for Nathan Yaussy Awarded Milken Educator Award 11/8/19
Go to comments for Substitute Teaching opportunities in our district

span.p: Need help accessing Infinite Campus? Please contact the school office for your special access code to create your parent account.

a.title: Go to comments for Infinite Campus

span.p: We are very excited to officially announce that McKinley has been AUTHORIZED to offer the Primary Years Program as an International Baccalaureate World School! As the first IB World School in Lake, Geauga and Ashtabula counties we are proud to offer this prestigious program to our school community.

a.title: Go to comments for McKinley- International Baccalaureate

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: Harding

strong.span: Excited to learn more about the upcoming

span.p: All updates on the FHEVS Building Project will be posted @ www.fhevs.org/buildingproject

a.title: Go to comments for FHEVS Building Project Updates - New Webpage

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.aria-label: Lakeland Community College - Virtual College Fair posted 4/23/20 Image

img.alt: Lakeland Community College - Virtual College Fair posted 4/23/20

a.span: Lakeland Community College - Virtual College Fair posted 4/23/20

p.span:
Lakeland Community College will be participating in a virtual college fair presented by the OACAC and StriveScan. This virtual college fair is for high school juniors, underclassmen, and their families. There is no cost for students/families to attend. Please share the following information with your students so they can continue their college search during this time of social distancing.
Lakeland Community College
Virtual College Fair
4/27/2020
7:00 p.m. Eastern time (all of the times on the official schedule are listed as central time)
Registration is required!
Click on article for the link to register.

a.title: Go to comments for Lakeland Community College - Virtual College Fair posted 4/23/20

a.aria-label: Parent Feedback/Survey-sent via Messenger on 4/22/20 Image

p.span: Keeping in touch with the school stakeholders has become more difficult, following the move to remote learning. Parents, pupils, and staff adapt to the new reality of remote learning and distance collaboration, but casual conversations in the halls, assemblies, and at the school gate are no longer an option. At the same time, the goals of the school remain the same ensure learning outcomes, make sure children are safe and well, and build the social fabric of the community around the school. After four weeks of remote learning, we invite you to share feedback as we strive to provide the best learning experience for our students. Kindly complete the online survey by clicking here to find link.

a.title: Go to comments for Parent Feedback/Survey-sent via Messenger on 4/22/20

a.aria-label: #13 COVID-19 Update-Closed for the remainder of the academic year 4/21/20 Image

img.alt: #13 COVID-19 Update-Closed for the remainder of the academic year 4/21/20

a.span: #13 COVID-19 Update-Closed for the remainder of the academic year 4/21/20

p.span:
Good morning Skippers,
First and foremost, thank you for your patience during this ever-changing time. Governor Mike DeWine announced that the state ordered school closure will extend through the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic school year. Staff will continue to plan and prepare the grade level online distance learning curriculum for students. We will continue to send updates to students and families throughout this time via Infinite Campus Messenger and our website, www.fhevs.org.
Please notify your building administrator if your child tells you they are unable to access the online learning opportunities. Our teachers and technology department will work with you to make sure your child has the access they need. We will make all attempts to answer your questions and offer assistance to the best of our ability.
McKinley Harding
Doreen Fischer Katie Rumbarger
dfischer@fhevs.org krumbarger@fhevs.org
440-354-5400, Ext. 354 440-354-5400, Ext. 301
We thank everyone for their patience and understanding during this time.

a.title: Go to comments for #13 COVID-19 Update-Closed for the remainder of the academic year 4/21/20

a.aria-label: Juniors: Get a Jump-Start on your Senior Year 5/13/20 Image

img.alt: Juniors: Get a Jump-Start on your Senior Year 5/13/20

a.span: Juniors: Get a Jump-Start on your Senior Year 5/13/20

p.span: Juniors: Get a Jump-Start on your Senior Year on May 13, 2020 at 6:30 p.m. LEAF will be holding a Virtual Resource Center Session online for high school juniors and their parents. Hear about the college application process senior timeline, and things to look for when visiting a college. Learn how and when to apply for admissions and financial aid. Register at https://leaf-ohio.org/resource-center-sessions/

a.title: Go to comments for Juniors: Get a Jump-Start on your Senior Year 5/13/20

a.aria-label: Returning CCP Students -Fall Semester Class Signups 4/14/20 Image

img.alt: Returning CCP Students -Fall Semester Class Signups 4/14/20

a.span: Returning CCP Students -Fall Semester Class Signups 4/14/20

p.span:
Good Morning All,
Just wanted to let you know that you may now register for Fall classes for CCP (Unless you are graduating this year). Complete the attached form, sign it and scan it to me and I will forward it to the college. If you are not sure on what classes to take, please let me know or contact Jami at Lakeland (JDiemer@lakelandcc.edu) or Josh at Lake Erie (jlinerode@lec.edu). Please do this by June 1! Remember, I also need a NEW intent form if you are continuing in CCP. That is attached to this original email.
Thank you,
Mrs. Jurick
Click image to print form.

a.title: Go to comments for Returning CCP Students -Fall Semester Class Signups 4/14/20

p.span:
We realize that many of our students rely on breakfast and lunch that they receive each day at school. We have updated our nutrition plan for the remainder of the mandatory school closure that ensures that students who need these meals will be able to get them.
We are following guidance from the health department to limit exposure and maintain social distancing. Staff will pass out meals at the Harding Jr/High School, Vine Street entrance near the Fairport Library. A Riverside/Fairport staff member will come to your car to get your student's names and then bring the meals to you. Students do not need to be present, and we would prefer only one person per family to come to pick the meals up. The meal pick-up plan is to protect both staff and families.
The school district will provide meal pick-ups on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. for the duration of the state-mandated school closure.
Important: Children from birth to age 18 may receive meals offered regardless of enrollment. Please do not exit your car; a staff member will come to your vehicle to pass out the meals. Thank you!

a.title: Go to comments for Nutrition Services (Updated 4/6/20)

p.span: Click here to find TONS of opportunities for Virtual Field Trips!

a.title: Go to comments for Virtual Field Trip Links 4/1/20

a.aria-label: New CCP Students for 2020-2021 School Year Information 4/1/2020 updated 4/15/20 Image

img.alt: New CCP Students for 2020-2021 School Year Information 4/1/2020 updated 4/15/20

a.span: New CCP Students for 2020-2021 School Year Information 4/1/2020 updated 4/15/20

p.span:
This information is intended for students who have NOT yet been admitted to the College Credit Plus program, but intend to participate during the 2020-2021 school year.
With the current restrictions, Lakeland and Lake Erie College are not able to schedule placement exams for prospective students. The Ohio Department of Education has recently released revised guidance for participation.
1. The Intent to participate deadline has been extended to May 1, 2020. Please see attached for the Intent to participate.
2. Depending on the length of the pandemic, colleges cannot test new students for fall term eligibility and admission consideration. In order to meet student eligibility requirements, a student shall have an overall high school grade point average (GPA) of 3.0, if that prospective College Credit Plus (CCP) student has not had the opportunity to complete an assessment exam due to this emergency.
3. If a prospective CCP student had previously completed an assessment exam and did not meet student eligibility requirements based on those scores, a college can consider that student is eligible if the student has an overall high school grade point average of 3.0.
4. The institution of higher education still has the opportunity to use institutional standards for admission decisions and placement into courses.
Update 4/15/20-Just a quick update regarding the College Credit Plus program. If your student is looking to enroll in college classes next year, the colleges are currently working on an option to give students a placement test remotely. More information should be coming soon. If students took the test and did not pass, they will have an option to take it again. If students had not yet tested, they will be able to.
If at any time you have any questions, please contact Mrs. Jurick at mjurick@fhevs.org.

a.title: Go to comments for New CCP Students for 2020-2021 School Year Information 4/1/2020 updated 4/15/20

a.aria-label: #12 COVID-19 Extended school closure until May 1, 2020 and Technology Assistance Image

img.alt: #12 COVID-19 Extended school closure until May 1, 2020 and Technology Assistance

a.span: #12 COVID-19 Extended school closure until May 1, 2020 and Technology Assistance

p.span:
Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced that the state ordered school closure will extend to at least Friday, May 1, 2020. We have been preparing for this extended closure and will continue to send updates to students and families throughout this time.
CLICK HERE FOR MORE IMPORTANT INFORMATION

a.title: Go to comments for #12 COVID-19 Extended school closure until May 1, 2020 and Technology Assistance

a.aria-label: #10 COVID-19 Response -Welcome Back To Online Learning From Staff Image

img.alt: #10 COVID-19 Response -Welcome Back To Online Learning From Staff

a.span: #10 COVID-19 Response -Welcome Back To Online Learning From Staff

p.span: We are very excited to welcome you back from Spring Break! Classes resume online tomorrow, March 30, 2020. Please be sure to check in with your teachers and be ready for a great week ahead! Click to get more info & to find the link to the Welcome Back Messages.

a.title: Go to comments for #10 COVID-19 Response -Welcome Back To Online Learning From Staff

p.span:
Dear Fairport Families:
With the entire state of Ohio, under a stay-at-home order to prevent the spread of COVID-19, Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine ordered public playgrounds to close to limit the spread of coronavirus. We have made the decision to close the playground at McKinley Elementary until further notice to reinforce social distancing and prevent further spread of the virus.
We encourage our students and families to engage in other outdoor activities, run, bike, hike while still adhering to the social distancing recommendations.
Thank you for your support and cooperation as we continue to adjust to the ever-evolving health situation in our communities.
Sincerely,
FHEVS Administration

a.title: Go to comments for #9 COVID-19 McKinley Playground Closed

a.aria-label: #8 COVID-19 IT Support While At Home 3/21/20 Image

img.alt: #8 COVID-19 IT Support While At Home 3/21/20

a.span: #8 COVID-19 IT Support While At Home 3/21/20

p.span:
We're here to help! Online Resources
To all of our districts throughout Northeast Ohio, we are here to support you as much as possible during the COVID-19 shutdown. It is our sincere hope that you will find some helpful technology resources here. Use the tabs at the top of the page to navigate to a help section or click the magnifying glass to search.

a.title: Go to comments for #8 COVID-19 IT Support While At Home 3/21/20

a.aria-label: #7 Covid 19 Response 3/20/20 Free and Low Income Internet Image

img.alt: #7 Covid 19 Response 3/20/20 Free and Low Income Internet

a.span: #7 Covid 19 Response 3/20/20 Free and Low Income Internet

p.span: Update: In response to COVID-19 developments, some internet providers are offering free services to low-income families and households with students. Well keep you updated with the latest here to help you stay connected. Click to learn more.

a.title: Go to comments for #7 Covid 19 Response 3/20/20 Free and Low Income Internet

p.span:
March 20, 2020
Dear Fairport Harbor Parents and Guardians,
The Fairport Harbor Schools recognizes how incredibly difficult the current situation is for our families. Our teachers have been working diligently to assign meaningful instructional content for students to complete away from school. Teachers are making remote learning opportunities available and can track progress as well as provide feedback that will permit students to advance to the next grade level as long as they engage with their teachers and the provided content.
To involve all of our students, we need to know how we can better assist our families. Please notify your building administrator for McKinley, dfischer@fhevs.org, or Harding krumbarger@fhevs.org, if your child tells you they are unable to access the online learning opportunities. Our teachers and technology department will work with you to make sure your child has the access they need. Many companies are now providing free internet. Please let us know if you do not have the technology for your child to utilize.
Regardless of the duration of this closure, our education community is determined to do everything in our power to help every student move on to the next grade in the fall and make sure every senior graduate on time! The Fairport School District expects that ALL students will continue their education online. To promote students to the next grade level, students must complete their assigned work, and we will support you through this. Beginning March 30th, the district will be closely monitoring student contributions to their online learning. Please note that the district will observe Spring Break the week of March 22 through March 28, with classes resuming on March 30, 2020.
Thank you,
Mrs. Doreen Fischer and Mrs. Katie Rumbarger Principal Principal

a.title: Go to comments for #6 Covid 19 Response 3/20/20 Instruction & Technology

p.span: Dear Skipper Families, I need to make you aware that on March 18, 2020, a parent called the school to self-report that they have been diagnosed with the COVID-19 virus. We are sharing this information with you because the parent attended March 12, 2020, parent-teacher conferences at McKinley Elementary. They did not have any interaction with students. We have contacted the Lake County Health Department for further guidance and we will keep you apprised of any further developments. Until then, please adhere to all prescribed safety procedures such as social distancing, hand-washing, and all other CDC guidelines. If you have additional concerns, the Ohio Department of Health has opened a call center to answer questions about COVID-19. The call center is open seven days a week from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. and can be reached at 1-833-427-5634. I am proud of the way everyone in our district has risen to the occasion and am more confident than ever in our ability to overcome this challenge. Stay well Skippers! References: Ohio Health Department: coronavirus.ohio.gov Centers for Disease Control & Prevention: CDC.gov World Health Organization: WHO.int Lake County General Health District: LCGHD.org

p.span: FH_Schools: Good Afternoon McKinley Skippers! As a reminder to those students who were not in attendance today, please plan on visiting McKinley on Monday, March 16th between the hours of 2:00-3:00 to retrieve blizzard bags/supplies. This will be the only time to get supplies. There is no school for students on Monday and the building will close at 3:00 and will not open until April 6th.

p.span:
JUST RUN 2020!!
****PRACTICES ARE SUSPENDED UNTIL THE BUILDING CLOSURE IS LIFTED***** 3/13/20
We are excited to announce that JUST RUN is back for another season! This year practices will start on March 31 and run through race day, which is May 23. This year JUST RUN will be open to students in grades K-12.
For those of you who are unfamiliar with JUST RUN, it is a FREE, multifaceted youth fitness program developed by the Big Sur Marathon Foundation. It not only promotes exercise and the sport of running but also good citizenship and healthy eating! The 5k race is held in Fairport Harbor in May and draws thousands of visitors!
The RACE REGISTRATION for students who want to participate and volunteers opens FEBRUARY 1, 2020.
I will make registration packets available to students starting Monday Feb 3, 2020 but you can also access all the required information by clicking on the link below.
ALSO!! Great news - our local Lake County Chapter of JUST RUN has officially obtained non-profit status! That means more fundraising opportunities and program expansion. If you or someone you know would like to DONATE to this awesome organization, I will be posting about how to do that very soon!
If you have questions please feel free to contact me at jpolak@fhevs.org
Looking forward to another successful season!
- Mrs. Polak

a.aria-label: CVC Babbitt, Schuster earn CVC Sportsmanship Awards 4/19/20 Image

img.alt: CVC Babbitt, Schuster earn CVC Sportsmanship Awards 4/19/20

a.span: CVC Babbitt, Schuster earn CVC Sportsmanship Awards 4/19/20

p.span:
Babbitt, Schuster earn CVC Sportsmanship Awards
By Steve Hare -April 19, 2020
Hannah Babbitt and Sam Schuster were named Fairport Hardings 2020 Chagrin Valley Conference Senior Sportsmanship Award winners.
Babbitt earned four letters in both volleyball and softball for the Skippers and she also was a member of the cheer squad.
In addition to recording the 1,000th dig of her career in the fall, Babbitt earned the schools Defensive Player of the Year Award in 2018 and 2019. She was named second-team All-CVC in volleyball and softball in 2019 and earned honorable mention all-conference honors in 2018.
Babbitt also excels in the classroom.
She earned a CVC Scholar-Athlete Award in 2019 and 2020 while taking College Credit Plus courses at Lakeland Community College. Babbitt is a member of the National Honor Society, the FHS Class President and a Student Ambassador who has committed over 1,000 hours of community service. She was named the Spanish 3 and History Student of the Year.
Schuster earned three varsity letters in football, one in basketball and four in baseball.
He was named second-team All-CVC in baseball following the 2018 and 2019 seasons and first-team All-Lake County in 2018 and 2019. The Lake County Touchdown Club recognized Schuster in 2019 and he was named the Fairport Offensive Player of the Year in 2019 and the Special Teams Player of the Year in 2018. Schuster earned honorable mention All-CVC honors for football in 2018 and 2019.
A member of the National Honor Society, Schuster is a CVC All-Academic honoree and CVC Scholar-Athlete. He is a member of the Deans List at Lakeland Community College and was named the Social Studies Student of the Year.
Click for link to video

a.title: Go to comments for CVC Babbitt, Schuster earn CVC Sportsmanship Awards 4/19/20

a.aria-label: 2019-20 News-Herald high school boys bowling all-stars 4/17/20 Image

img.alt: 2019-20 News-Herald high school boys bowling all-stars 4/17/20

a.span: 2019-20 News-Herald high school boys bowling all-stars 4/17/20

p.span:
PLAYER OF THE YEAR
Michael Chipps
Fairport, senior
Chipps finished his senior year with a bang, rolling a 689 at the Division II state tournament to place seventh among individuals. He also helped lead the Skippers to a runner-up finish in the team tournament. Chipps tied for 19th at the D-II Nautica District with 599 pins and placed second at the Wickliffe Sectional with a score of 609.
COACH OF THE YEAR
Jerry Rich, Fairport
The Skippers continued their run of area dominance through the 2019-20 season, a campaign that culminated in a runner-up finish at the D-II state tournament. Four of Rich's bowlers placed among the top 26 at Wayne Webb's Columbus Bowl. Fairport picked up the Nautica District title by 109 pins and rolled up a 3,996 team score at the Wickliffe Sectional to claim that championship by a 563-pin margin.
FIRST TEAM
Ryan Chipps, So., Fairport
A key cog on the Skippers' state runner-up team, Chipps rolled 638 to finish 12th at D-II state; 9th at Nautica District with 622 and rolled 608 for 3rd at Wickliffe Sectional
Connor Hulett, Jr., Fairport
Placed 24th at D-II state with 603; knocked down 349 pins to finish 45th at Wickliffe Sectional
Joe Justinger, So., Fairport
Rolled 600 to take 26th at D-II state; tied for 19th with 599 at Nautica District and rolled 647 to win Wickliffe Sectional title
HONOR ROLL:
Fairport: Mike Rentz, Matt Oravecz, Christian Nelson
Click for more!

a.title: Go to comments for 2019-20 News-Herald high school boys bowling all-stars 4/17/20

p.span: The Think Fast Interactive was Friday for students in grades 9-12. ThinkFast was developed in 1997 as a program that would non-intrusively expose participants to and educate them on important information on hard-to-tackle topics, i.e. the consequences of underage drinking, drug use, bullying, traffic safety, distracted driving, etc., while simultaneously entertaining them in a safe, relaxed and fun environment.

a.title: Go to comments for Think Fast! 3/6/20

p.span: Harding High School 8th graders joined our McKinley kindergartners in celebrating Read Across America Day on Tuesday! The students paired up to read together, play reading games and just enjoyed each other's company. A huge thank you to Mrs. Knight for bringing such great role models to McKinley!!

span.data-lucid-content: {"t":"What is a Quality Profile? \nThe purpose of the Quality Profile is to provide the rest of the story, giving the Fairport Harbor community a report on how our schools are performing in the areas that matter most.The Fairport Harbor community believes schools should provide opportunities for students to pursue excellence in many forms. The education we provide goes far beyond what is measured by the Ohio Department of Education standardized tests. The best way to prepare them for success in college, career and life is to create opportunities for personalized learning tailored to individual student talents and interests. That is why Fairport students are learning today and leading tomorrow.","m":[{"s":0,"n":"b","v":true,"e":26},{"s":0,"n":"c","v":"#000000ff","e":698}]}

p.span: What is a Quality Profile? The purpose of the Quality Profile is to provide the rest of the story, giving the Fairport Harbor community a report on how our schools are performing in the areas that matter most.The Fairport Harbor community believes schools should provide opportunities for students to pursue excellence in many forms. The education we provide goes far beyond what is measured by the Ohio Department of Education standardized tests. The best way to prepare our studentsfor success in college, career, and life is to create opportunities for personalized learning tailored to individual student talents and interests. That is why Fairport students are learning today and leading tomorrow.
